channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping by bin near cinnar, 5th November
item.description:
Flytipping be bin near cinnar including Amazon box with address. There was a camera out up which detered people for a while but flytipping is now back at the bin by the cinnar shop and bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 404, Footscray Road, New Eltham, London

item.title: Lamp post light is flickering brightly., 5th November
item.description:
The lamp has been flashing non stop for a month now. I thought it was an emergency service or road works but it's just looks like a dodgy light bulb. The whole street corner flashes at night. It must be a hazard for drivers too who could be falsely alarmed by the flashing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Lane, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on the planter and pavement on Tabard Street, 5th November
item.description:
There are food packaging, rubbish bags and paper on the on planters and pavement on Tabard Street specifically around the brown planters. This has not been cleared up despite Fixmystreet stating it was removed. It has been there for seven days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tabard Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street lighting in the park, 5th November
item.description:
Once the sun goes down, the paths are so dark that you can’t see where you’re walking. I had to walk with my phone torch on. It really doesn’t feel safe, and it feels like it’d be easy to trip up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carriage Drive, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Rochester Terrace, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left being following bin collection, 5th November
item.description:
Today (Wednesday, 5 November 2025), following the bin collection on Liddon Road BR1 2SR, a large amount of loose rubbish, split bags and spilled recycling has been left along the pavements between houses number 19 and 29. This poses a slip/trip hazard, attracts vermin and risks blocking gullies. This is a frequent occurrence - Bin workers do not pick up trash that is left of the ground when clearing bins and frequently leave the road dirty. This is unacceptable. Please arrange an urgent street clean and sweep of this stretch, and review the contractor’s handling practices to prevent recurrence. Photos attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Liddon Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road condition - Fullarton Crescent, 5th November
item.description:
Fullarton Crescent road surface is very poor with traces of asphalt covering what use to be a concrete road. Many channels and conduits have been dug into the road covering cables which run across the road between sidewalks and these now create structural damage to road surface. This road conditions makes it unsafe and raises vehicle maintenance costs due to impact on suspension when driven over. Additionally during inclement weather conditions, mixture of asphalt and concrete road surface creates increased risk of skidding and accident as a result of loss of traction and poor water displacement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fullarton Crescent, South Ockendon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More graffiti to be removed, 5th November
item.description:
Hello. Please can this graffiti be removed asap? It’s now been reported this 3 times: each week another drug-related tag appears, and it makes the area feel unsafe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Park Road, Stockwell, London
